security_audit.summary: This is a benign brand management skill consisting of Python utility modules for document formatting. The code only manipulates data structures and configuration dictionaries without network access, file system manipulation beyond its own directory, or external command execution.

content.user_title: Apply corporate brand guidelines to documents
content.value_statement: Creating documents with inconsistent branding damages professional image. This skill applies unified corporate styling to Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF files, ensuring every output meets brand standards for colors, fonts, and layouts automatically.
actual_capabilities: Apply brand colors and fonts to Excel spreadsheet configurations
Format PowerPoint presentations with corporate slide templates
Style PDF documents with brand headers, footers, and typography
Validate documents against brand compliance standards
Generate chart color palettes matching brand palette
Format numbers and text according to brand guidelines
limitations: Does not generate actual documents (only configuration for document generation)
Requires integration with document creation skills or libraries
Brand colors and fonts are predefined (customizable in code)
Does not handle image assets or logo placement directly

use_cases.title: Create branded presentations
use_cases.description: Generate consistent PowerPoint decks that match corporate identity for client pitches and internal reviews.

use_cases.title: Standardize report formatting
use_cases.description: Apply uniform styling to Excel spreadsheets and PDFs across quarterly reports and data analyses.

use_cases.title: Integrate brand compliance
use_cases.description: Add brand validation to document generation pipelines ensuring all outputs meet corporate standards.

best_practices: Integrate brand validation early in document creation workflows to catch issues before final output.
Use the validator to check content before generating documents rather than after.
Customize color and font definitions in the code to match your specific brand before deployment.
Combine with document generation skills (Excel, PowerPoint, PDF skills) for complete workflow automation.
anti_patterns: Manually applying brand colors without validation risks inconsistent results across documents.
Using unapproved fonts or colors undermines brand recognition and professionalism.
Skipping the validation step leads to compliance issues in external communications.
Hardcoding values instead of using the brand formatter makes future updates difficult.

faq.question: Which document formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF document formatting through configuration objects. Integration with actual document generation requires additional libraries or skills.

faq.question: Can I customize the brand colors and fonts?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit the COLORS and FONTS dictionaries in apply_brand.py to match your organization's brand palette and typography standards.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with document generation?
faq.answer: Use the brand formatter to generate configuration objects, then pass those configurations to document creation libraries like python-docx, python-pptx, or reportlab.

faq.question: Is user data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill processes data locally within the AI conversation and does not transmit data externally. It only manipulates configuration dictionaries in memory.

faq.question: Why is my document not passing brand validation?
faq.answer: Common issues include using non-approved colors (check hex codes), unapproved fonts, prohibited words in text, or incorrect brand name capitalization. Review the validation report for specific issues.

faq.question: How does this compare to using a design template?
faq.answer: This skill provides programmatic brand application that can be integrated into automated workflows. Templates work well for manual creation but require more effort to maintain consistency at scale.
